tasks.title: Add property-based testing infrastructure with proptest
tasks.description:
Introduce property-based testing using the proptest crate to catch edge cases in serialization, pagination, and business logic. Current tests are example-based and may miss edge cases like empty collections, maximum values, or malformed input.

Target areas:
- Pagination logic (offset/count bounds, has_next calculation)
- Serde serialization/deserialization roundtrips
- Date/time parsing edge cases
- URL encoding/query parameter generation
- Response parsing with varying field presence

Property-based tests generate hundreds of random inputs to find edge cases that human-written tests miss. This improves reliability and catches regressions in data handling.

tasks.title: Add circuit breaker pattern for resilient API calls
tasks.description:
Implement circuit breaker pattern to prevent cascading failures when Splunk API is struggling. Current retry logic retries forever without considering overall system health.

Circuit breaker states:
- Closed: Normal operation, requests pass through
- Open: Failure threshold exceeded, requests fail fast
- Half-Open: Testing if service recovered

Configuration per endpoint:
- failure_threshold: 5 errors in 60s to open
- reset_timeout: 30s before half-open test
- half_open_requests: 1 test request allowed

Benefits:
- Fast fail during outages (better UX than hanging)
- Prevents overwhelming struggling Splunk instances
- Automatic recovery detection
- Metrics for circuit state changes

Implementation wraps the client with circuit breaker middleware using failsafe or custom implementation.
evidence: Retry logic exists but retries forever without circuit breaking (crates/client/src/endpoints/request.rs:174-421)
